titleStmt.title: Citamparam, Nāṭarāja temple, time of Rājendra Cōḻa, year 24

msContents.summary: Gift of land for performing various services during festival, including adhyayana.

projectDesc.p: The project DHARMA has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement no 809994).

prefixDef.p: Public URIs with the prefix bib to point to a Zotero Group Library named ERC-DHARMA whose data are open to the public.
Internal URIs using the part prefix to point to person elements in the DHARMA_IdListMembers_v01.xml file.

revisionDesc.change: Creation of the file on the repository

div.p: {pc} cakala-puvaṉa-c-cakkaravattikaḷ śrī kō-p-peruñ-ciṅka-tēvarkku yāṇṭu muppattāṟ’ āvatu siṃhanāyaṟṟu-t tiyati Oṉpatiṉāl taṉiyūr perumpaṟṟappuliyūr mulapparuṣaiyār Eḻuttu

nammuūr nilakkaṇakku taṉmappiriyaṉum tillai muvāyira veḷāṉum kaṇṭu nammuūr mel piṭākai kaṅkaikoṇṭacōḻa-p periḷamai nāṭṭu Ac-cēri-c cāttaṅ-kuṭi-y-āṉa mayilpālakulakāla nallūr-p pāl śrī cuntara-cōḻavatikku mēṟku cōḻakulacuntara vāykkālukku teṟkku
{6-6 -kaṇṇāṟṟu} 3-catirattu Etirilicōḻaṉ tirunantavaṉattu Ellaikku mēṟkku-p-paṭṭa nilattu kulottuṅkacōḻaṉ tiruttōppukku maṇ koṇṭa kuḻiyāy taramiliyāy mārāyar kūttappirāṉār Uḷḷuṭṭār pēril māppeṟu peṟṟa nilamāy Ivarkaḷ pakkal muṉṉāḷil mutaliyār tirumañcaṇam aḻakiyār vilai koṇṭu tāmarai Ōṭaiyāy Ivar puṉpayiṟ-c ceytu Aṉupavittu varukiṟa kuḷam tukuttu mutaliyār tiruvaiyāṟ’ uṭaiyār tillai nāyaka-c caru
ppeti maṅkalam Eṉṉum tirunāmattāl vaitta Akarattu brāhmaṇar nāyakar tiruttēr Eḻuntaruḷum pōtu tiruppuṟa-k-kuṭaiyilē Adhyayaṉam paṇṇi sevittum tirunāḷkaḷilum tiruvvasantaṉ tirunāḷilum kulottuṅkacōḻaṉ tiruttoppilil Eḻuntaruḷiṉāl svasti colli sevittum tirumañcaṉa kālattu Adhyayaṉam paṇṇi sevittum Etirilicōḻaṉ tirunantavaṉattu piḷḷaiyār civapātacekaraṉ cittattuṇai-p perumāḷ Uṟsava
ṅkaḷukku tiruppālivala-t tirunāḷkkaḷukku Eḻuntaruḷiṉāl {kāṇi symbol + unknown} Agrahaṇam paṇṇi Aruḷum pōtu svasti colliyum cēvittu-p pōtukiṟa Akarattu brāhmaṇar palakaṭṭaḷaikaḷilum palarpakkal dāṉam ākavum vilai-y ākavum koṇṭu Aṉupavikkiṟa {land symbol + 9 + arai symbol}

Iṉ-nṉilam Oṉpataraiyum Ampalanāyaka-p perunteruvil tirunāvukkaracu-tēvaṉ tirumaṭattu nāyaṉār Aḻakiya tiruvaiyāṟ’ uṭaiyār kiḻai-t tiruvācal mukkaṭṭaṇattu Eḻuntaruḷi Iruntu pūjai koṇṭaruḷukiṟa kulottuṅnka-cōḻa viṉāya
ka-p piḷḷiayārai rājākkaḷ tampirāṉ tiruvīti nāyakar tiruppavaṉi Eḻuntaruḷum pōtu tirukkaṇ cāttiyaruḷum nāḷkkaḷukku tirumuṉpu cēvikkum tirukkāṭccikaḷukkum tiruppaṇṇikārattukkum viṭṭa *land + arai* Iṉ-nṉilam Araiyum Āka {land + 10}-li

Iṉ-nṉilam patiṟṟu veliyum Iṉnṉāḷ mutal muṉpu Uṭaiyār Aḻakiya tiruvaiyāṟ’ uṭaiyār tirunāmattukkāṇikku nāṅkaḷ muṉpu Eḻutikkuṭutta vivasteppaṭiyē Uṭaiyār tirucciṟṟampalamuṭaiyārkku tiruttēr maṭakku viḻukkāṭṭilē tiruttēr Eḻuntaruḷivikkavum kōyiṟku kuṭimai Uḷḷiṭṭa sabhāvi niyākamum maṟṟum ceṉṉir Amaiñci Uḷḷiṭṭa tēvaikaḷum
veḷḷāṉ veṭṭiyum Uṭpaṭa Eppērpaṭṭaṉavum tavirntu Ūrkkiḻ Iṟaiyiliy-āka Utakam paṇṇikkuṭukkaiyil Iṉ-nṉilattunkku vantaṉa Ūrilē Eṟṟi Iṟukkavum Iṉnṉilaṅkaḷ Oḻukum maṭakkum piṟakkum Iṭattu tillaināyaka-c-caru-p-peti-maṅkalattu Adhyayaṉa paṭṭarkaḷ peri(l) tillaimuvāyiraviḷākam Eṉṉum perālē Eḻuta-k kaṭavarkaḷ ākavum
Ippaṭikku tirumāḷikaiyilē kal veṭṭikkoḷḷa-k kaṭavarkaḷ ākavum kaṭavat’ Ākavum coṉṉem
Ivai Aruḷāl Ūrkkaṇakku Eṭutta poṟpātappiriyaṉ Eḻuttu
Ippaṭikku mulaparuṣaiyār Eḻuttiṭṭa niyōkam tarukkaikoṭṭiyil Oṭukki kal veṭṭiyatu {pc}

This is the signature of the members of the chief assembly (mulapparuṣaiyār) of the temple at the independent village of Perumpaṟṟappuliyūr, dated on the ninth day of the Siṃha month of the year 36 of the glorious king Peruñciṅka, alias Cakala Puvaṉa Cakkaravattikaḷ.

The accountant of the lands (nilakkaṇakku) Taṉmappiriyaṉ of Nammūr and a vēḷāṉ Muvāyira from Tillai examined (kaṇṭu) the plot of land (catiram) [situated] on a hamlet to the west of Nammūr, which is on the third branch channel (kaṇṇāṟu), south of the Cōḻakulacuntara channel (vāykkāl), west to the sacred Cuntaracōḻa cross channel (vati) on the Mayilpāla Kulakāla Nallūr section (pāl), also known as (āṉa) Accēri Cāttaṅkuṭi in the Kaṅkaikoṇṭacōḻa Perimaḷai-nāṭu.
Translated here for DHARMA (ERC n° 809994) by Renato Dávalos and and Emmanuel Francis (2024), based on .
